t: For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm of David.
Answer*pn me when I call to you, my*ld righteous God. Give*ln me relief from my distress; have*ld mercy on me and hear my prayer.
How*pn long will you people turn my glory into shame? How*ld long will you love delusions and seek false gods?
Know*ln that the Lord*s has set apart his faithful servant for himself; the*ld Lord*s hears when I call to him.
Tremble*pn and do not sin; when*ld you are on your beds, search*ld your hearts and be silent.
Offer*ln the sacrifices of the righteous and*ld trust in the Lord.*s
Many,*pn Lord,*s are asking, “Who will bring us prosperity?” Let*ld the light of your face shine on us.
Fill*ln my heart with joy when*ld their grain and new wine abound.
In*pn peace I will lie down and sleep, for*ld you alone, Lord,*s make*ld me dwell in safety.
